Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 08:45PM misheley wrote: Jumping in here... Did any of you seek out a second opinion after receiving a benign pathology report and then get a cancer diagnosis? Michele
Posts.Title: 2nd opinion: Pathology? EleanorJ misheley

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2008 05:07AM misheley wrote: No, you're not crazy.  I'm sorry that they didn't give you an ultrasound.  Is there another place you can go?  Can your OB write you an order for an US?  If you are worried about your symptoms, and it sounds like you are, don't dismiss it until you've gotten an answer that satisfies you.   Good luck with things! Michele

Posts.Title: One week to go.... kelsgotacamera misheley

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2008 02:32PM misheley wrote: Rene, I'm glad things went well for you.  For me, the anesthesia was the worst part. My surgeon did a wedge resection which is removal of some tissue surrounding the symptomatic duct.  My results came back benign, but I got a second opinion and I am having my slides read again by a pathgologist at a comprehensive breast center.  Those results should be back any day now. I'll post an update when I hear anything. Take care, Michele
Posts.Title: Pending Duct Excision.....PLEASE HELP Rene48 Grannyx2

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 10:08AM misheley wrote: How are you feeling today, Rene?  I'm hoping that the surgery went well and that they were able to find the causative duct. I had a duct excision and wedge resection back in September. I wish I would have seen your post sooner, I would have sent you some pre-surgery hugs. Let us know how you are feeling and how your pathology comes back.  Thinking good thoughts for you- Michele
Posts.Title: Pending Duct Excision.....PLEASE HELP Rene48 Grannyx2

Posts.Content: misheley wrote: Hello, ladies.  I hope you don't mind helping out a newbie. I was having bloody nipple discharge, one side, one duct.  I had ductoscopy and major duct excision performed on Sept 4th.  They took one duct and did a wedge resection to the surrounding tissue.  The other duct they explored, but did not take.  Path report was benign-hyperplasia, chronic inflammation, lobular changes consistent with fibrocystic disease, no evidence of atypia or malignancy.  Now it is almost 4 weeks later and I am having bloody discharge again.  Has anyone experienced this?  Michele Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 09:45AM misheley wrote: I heard back from the surgeon and she said it was probably a seroma and not to worry.  She said if it's still happening in a few weeks call her again. Michele
Posts.Title: post major duct excision problems misheley misheley

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2008 12:01PM misheley wrote: I am seeing a breast specialist/surgeon.  She is not an oncologist, I don't think.  She runs a breast center and is highly recommended in the area.  I haven't yet called them.  For some reason I feel like I am overreacting.  I know this sounds stupid, but every test so far has been benign and I feel like I'll be seen as a crazy person.  It's so frustrating.  I will call. Michele
Posts.Title: post major duct excision problems misheley misheley

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 10:34PM misheley wrote: Thanks, Shirlann. I appreciate what you are saying.  I am not completely at ease with this situation.  Initially I was, but now that the bleeding has returned I have started questioning a few things.  How does fibrocystic change cause bloody nipple discharge?  The only thing I could find that is known to cause this was papilloma and cancer.  I know these are questions I need to ask my surgeon.  She is more than sweet and helpful, but I try to do my research in advance. Thanks so much for listening! Michele
Posts.Title: post major duct excision problems misheley misheley

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2008 03:24PM misheley wrote: Hi, Sue. I had one duct taken in a wedge resection on September 4th.  I am still a tiny bit sore, but only when something bumps me.  Recovering from the anesthesia was worse than the breast surgery, to be honest.  Ice really helped a lot. I hope all goes well for you! Michele
